comment: Not too bad, but if you can, take someone else. Class felt less like a history class and more like watch these videos and let's see how much you retain. Video quizzes suck, she asks questions on the things in the video that were BARELY mentioned. Felt like she was testing us on how much little things we remember. Tests are very easy though
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: THIS CLASS IS A JOKE. Good luck if you decide to take this "professor." She only gives tests and quizzes - no extra credit. The wording on these tests and quizzes makes me feel like I'm the one who is using too much of the "greenery" yet she must be. I don't understand how she is even a professor at a UNIVERSITY. Step on some legos.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Ward, might be the worst professor I have had my entire college career. She ONLY has tests and quiz grades - so if you screw up on one GOOD LUCK. This class is a joke of a history class, half of the test/quiz questions I think we're made up, because none of it is found in lectures, notes, or the textbook. DONT TAKE IT. kick rocks.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: It's like she wants you to fail. There is absolutely ZERO margin for error in this class and the tests and quizzes have information that simply does not exist in any of her lectures. Yes, despite watching the videos, taking notes, and studying the notes. Go ahead and deduct 15% from your expectations before you take her quizzes or exams, it helps.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment: Worst professor I've taken at KSU, she is extremely unorganized and has so much work throughout each week. She acts as if this is everyone's major and everyone cares about it as much as she is. This is definitely a class you have to be interested in if you have this professor. Ig do your work and you'll be fine?
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I thought this was going to be a simple history class. Well WRONG. She overloads you with 5+ videos a week and up to 4 chapters of reading on a given week. She says to work at your own pace, but even when following her setup, you have NO time to study and she is also making us work over spring break and then have exams the week after. A disaster.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: There are 4 quizes and 1 test per unit with 3 units. Primary source quiz (not lockdown) Textbook quiz(not lockdown) Video quiz(lockdown) and unit test(lockdown). Quizes=10 questions Tests=30 with mini essay question at end. She tells you before hand what prompt is. This is all for one unit. Unit 3=major essay assignment that is graded hard but ezy.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Very good professor! Follow her directions and you will do well. 3 modules, at the end of each exam is a essay prompt that she lets everyone know ahead of time. Final assignment is a primary source essay where she gives a speech and you can ONLY cite the speech, just follow directions. 3 quizzes per unit, hilarious test questions! Answers emails.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: 3 units with 4 assignments each. 1 additional paper. The textbook is barely touched except for the 3 "textbook" quizzes. 21 lecture videos and 22 "instructional" videos that are just short youtube videos. The paper only has one short source allowed to use with ridiculous amounts of points being taken off for mistakes like not being double spaced.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy

comment: I'm never taking her again. If you love to read about history take her but this class isn't easy. Watch all videos and read the book or you will fail the tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: There are only 13 assignments the entire semester, 3 units composed of 4 tests (2/4 are on lockdown) and a primary source paper. As long as you read the textbook and watch all the lectures and videos while taking notes, you should be okay. Only downside is all of the tests are due at 4pm no if ands or buts so make sure to double check the syllabus.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Horrible professor. She's a wolf in sheep's clothing. Loads of material to study and the content is barely on the tests. Avoid her at all costs. No extra credit. No room for mess ups. And she's extremely stingy when it comes to grading.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: In terms of scheduling and what needs to be done, it is not difficult. The problem is the test questions. If there is one fact that is likely to be overlooked out of an entire chapter or video, that is the question she will ask. Words tests to be confuse you. Very manipulated questions. Will show you no grace for any reason

In my opinion, most of her quizzes and exams were not really related to the info in her lectures. She also had an essay where we could only use a specific speech as our "source" and could use outside sources. She let us use the textbook for this essay, but there wasn't much information that helped with the essay. She is sweet, but not for me.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Prof Ward is so organized for online learners. Her expectations are clear, and the questions on all quizzes/tests are fair. She is a quick grader. No cumulative tests. 3 units, each has 2 easy quizzes and a test that is 1/2 essay. She gives essay prompt weeks in advance. Can complete each unit at your own pace. Super easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: 3 quizzes and 1 exam every month plus one essay is the only stuff you do in this class. Not a lot of work so you gotta do good on what is given and she grades the essay really harshly. Other than that I never interacted with her because it was 100% online so I cannot speak for her character.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: She was a very sweet lady and made quick easy lecture videos to watch. She also provides a suggested weekly schedule to follow which was really helpful since the class was asynchronous online. If you watch the videos and read the textbook chapters, it's an easy A. I didn't read the textbook so I did poorly on the textbook quizzes.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: The class work is dived into 3 section and each section is only graded on quizzes and an exam. Only 1 paper in the last section. As a CS major this class was easy and was able to finish everything way before the due date. Con: all quizzes and exam use lockdown with webcam.
rating_tags: Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Class was asynchronous and the criteria for assignments was clear. Graded quickly and feedback was helpful. The class was well organized and I was able to complete all the assignments without a problem. Never spoke to the professor the whole class (online). Overall I would take this teacher again for sure if it was online.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: She makes this class harder then it needs to be. Take this class if you don't have a life outside of KSU because she thinks she is the only teacher on your schedule.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: TAKE HER!!! Best history and online professor I have ever had. Her d2l page is very clear and easy to follow. Only one essay that is pretty easy. Lecture videos are interesting. Must take notes and study to be successful-- but very easy to do. The content is well laid out and interesting (coming from a person that does not like history courses).
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: DO NOT TAKE HER ONLINE CLASS, THE LECTURES ARE RIDICULOUSLY LONG FOR A 10 QUESTION QUIZ. 8- 15 MINUTE VIDEOS FOR ONE 10 QUESTION QUIZ? STUPID. AND SHE GRADES RIDICULOUSLY HARD.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Ward seems like a caring person, but taking the online class didn't give me the opportunity to really see it. The material is not hard (just be disciplined in watching the lecture videos she provides), but her grading is absolutely ridiculous. Do well on multiple choice assignments so you have breathing room on written assignments.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: I took her online class and honestly it's much easier than any of the other online history courses and easy to complete for a CS major like me who doesn't care about history that much. She provides lecture videos that are interesting and easy to take notes from so the exams aren't bad at all. You can complete each unit at your own pace too.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Her online class is a joke. 3 Units and 4 quizzes each unit. If you go over the notes its fairly easy (open note for all but the exam), but the textbook quiz is short response and she will count an answer as wrong even if you answer it 100% correctly but are missing A word. For one of mine she asked why id didn't answer a question she didn't ask..
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: Professor Ward is amazing! Class consists of 9 total grades- 3 tests, 3 pop quizzes, and 3 textbook essays. Notes can be used on quizzes, and if you meet with her before essays are due, she will tell you what is missing to ensure a 100. Test can be difficult, but the 1st is the hardest. No cumulative final. Overall, a great professor and easy A!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Hilarious

comment: I'm sure Ms. Ward is a really good professor in class, but online she gives out the hardest tests and textbook quizzes, she only grades a few things and if you fail one test you basically will not get a B. She is possibly the worst professor I've ever had online.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Tough grader

comment: She's real with her students and refuses to sugarcoat history. I love her! I've have a lot of fun with history and really enjoy it, but she made it even better. But you really do need to show up to class because there is a lot of information you can miss. Not a class you can slack off in.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Attendance isn't mandatory, but you SHOULD go because her lectures are amazing. She's hilarious; she makes the material come to life. And you need her notes to do well on the 3 tests & she gives 3 pop quizzes. You only need textbook for 3 short take-home essays; all test notes come from lectures. She's SO NICE & always there to help outside class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Super funny prof and pretty understanding. 3 tests (including final), 3 essays (one page), and 3 pop quizzes. Go to lecture everyday, you need to for detailed notes and possibility of a quiz. Final is non cumulative as well.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Mrs. Ward is extremely knowledgeable and does a great job teaching the content. I really enjoyed her lectures and she clearly cares. Show up, pay attention, and you'll be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor ward is an amazing! There are only 3 tests and 3 one page papers. Her lectures are amazing and you can tell she turly loves history. She also cracks jokes all the time which picks the whole class up if the topic is a bit boring. Each class is a lecture so try not to skip as the test is off of the lecture material. Overall amazing class!
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Her lectures were amazing and I love her humor. 3 tests and 3 one-page essays. She plays music before class starts. I would recommend going to class, makes studying a lot easier. The exams are based on lecture terms she gives us before every class and a few map locations and videos you have to watch in your own time.
rating_tags: Respected--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: AMAZING professor and not boring to listen to. You will do better on the tests if you show up. Only 6 grades total, 3 tests and 3 essays. The essays are VERY easy (only 1 page max) and you use the textbook. no extra credit. tests are fairly easy but you still need to study. very easy class as long as you study.
rating_tags: Respected--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures

comment: Amy is super sweet. Her lectures are super long, but its important. She gives lecture terms which are the entire test and a few videos and map locations. Form a study group!! The only time you use your textbook is for the textbook essays. You entire grade is based off 3 exams and 3 one page essays. SHOW UP.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Ward is an amazing lecturer and made learning the material more enjoyable. You must go to class in order to get the info needed for the exams and the textbook is required for the 3 1-page textbook essays. Also, make sure to watch the videos she posts on D2L before the exams.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Really great professor and fairly easy class. Three tests, three one page papers. She has "lecture terms" that the test is based around. Essays are from the textbook. She's funny and incorporates that in her test answers.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: A cool prof, not a hard class just make sure you make a google doc with some friends incase you need to miss some days. Also helpful because shes 100% lecture so some people catch stuff that you didnt notice.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Ward is so funny! Her lectures are interesting and she makes history fun. You do not have to show up to class; she does take attendance but it is only to see if she can help if you need it. You only have three tests and three one-page essays. By far the best history teacher I've ever had! Loved her entire class!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Ward is amazing! Just by the music she plays before class, she is invited to the cookout. She doesn't require attendance but she doesn't post her PowerPoint online. You only need your textbook for 3 essays so I recommend renting the book from Amazon. If you take good notes, watch the videos, and look at the map locations you will be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Ward is willing to work with you, gives great lectures with a good sense of humor, and makes her expectations clear. You must have the textbook for the short essay due on the date of the test, but otherwise all information needed is given in the class lectures in which she will point out what you will be tested on.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof Ward is amazing. She sets her students up for success. There isn't a textbook and she doesn't post her powerpoints, but attendance isn't required. There are 5 pop quizzes throughout the semester and they are just points for attendance. Tests are SO easy too. She's funny and makes lectures interesting so it is definitely worth going to class

If you go to class, take good notes, & study you will pass this class easily. I was wary of taking her because I thought it would be difficult, but it isn't! I've never been a history person, but I really enjoyed her lectures (learned a lot). She is really funny too! Strict on assignments and due dates though. Watch the videos she gives you!!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Prof Ward is amazing! By far my favorite teacher of college so far. She makes history seem really interesting. Our grade consisted of 3 tests, 5 pop quizzes, and 2 papers which were a page each. Relatively easy... and to top it all off she's one of the nicest people ever!
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Do not take. Shes a tough grader and if you are not a good test taker there are no other options to succeed in the class.
rating_tags: Tough Grader

comment: Do not take her class. She offers no extra credit assignments & only gives 3 tests & one project. You must do good on all 3 to pass the course. Her written quizzes are also difficult to pass and are biased. She never gives you back quizzes & tests so you can review them to see what you got wrong.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Love this teacher, two papers... three tests and 5 pop quizzes given to show attendance in the class. She lectures ALOT but its all important stuff that is seen on the tests. I would take her again because I like her style of teaching. TAKE HER!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: We had three tests. Five pop quizzes (that you get a 100 on if you turn them in so they basically check attendance) and 2 easy one page papers. Gives amazing lectures but talks kind of fast. Show up, take good notes, and watch the videos she tells you to and you'll do fine. She's really funny and I would totally take her again.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Prof. Ward was a nice lady who was really enthusiastic about teaching but the tests were very difficult. there were 2 pop quizes. lectures can be boring but take good notes. also 2 writing assignments which werent bad.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Tests are tough--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She was a great history professor. The lectures were very informative and you could tell that she really enjoyed teaching. Watch out for the pop quizzes, they're easy but you have to attend class regularly.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Hilarious

comment: She is a great professor. She is very knowledgeable in History and teachers and lectures very well. The class itself is somewhat had though. There is a ton of material per test and there are not many tests. But she is a great professor for the most part.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures--Tests are tough

comment: Prof. Ward is truly a living history textbook. Her lectures are amazing, and she is funny and full of energy. The pop quizzes are open note, and the first part of her tests are open textbook. READ THE BOOK BEFOREHAND! KNOWING WHERE THE MATERIAL IS IN THE BOOK WILL SAVE YOU TIME AND GET YOU A GOOD GRADE! Writing assignments require outside sources.
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Very funny which made her lectures interesting. She uses examples that are relatable. Midterm and final are essays but she gives you the questions before hand and you are allowed one note card. The tests are easy as long as you take good notes and pay attention to videos. There is a textbook portion of every test, so buy the textbook. Highly rec.
rating_tags: Hilarious--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Ms. Ward was a great teacher. You have to be sure to attend lectures as she isn't the type to put all the information on the slides. She did a great job of making sure the information was accessible. As long you take good notes, you shouldn't have any problems.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: Amy is overall a good prof. Class isn't easy but if you take it serious an A isn't too hard to get. Completely lecture based but all her lectures are simple and on her website. She is really fun and nice and her class overall was pretty fun 8/10 would recommend to a friend
rating_tags: BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She posts her pp's online before hand so you can copy those down, but still go to class because the PP's only have the bare minimum of info, she goes into great detail in class. Make sure you watch the videos before tests because she asks specific questions on them, also study your notes and mark up your book on thetopicsforthebookportionofthetest
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: There were 3 tests with a short answer that you get to use your book on and a multiple choice section to be completed without the book. There was also a final and midterm writing assignment. She gives you the sample questions for these written assignments and you get to use 3 notecards for them. There were 2 quizzes (can use notes) that were easy.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Enjoyed this professor. Would definitely take again. Attendance not mandatory but she gives 2 pop quizzes so you might wanna go. Her test are VERBATIM her lectures if you go to class and take notes you'll do great on test. Grading criteria and assignments very straight forward.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Professor Ward is hilarious and she makes her lectures relevant. If you do what she tells you to do, you'll get a B easy. Working for the A is hard because the final and midterms are writing assessments and even when you think you've written enough, you haven't. Overall she's a great person and teacher!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Amazing lectures

comment: She's really knowledgeable and lectures are very informative so take good notes. she is clear on what she expects you to know for tests. 3 tests and a final with two pop quizzes. she is very honest and communicates well with the class. while attendance is not mandatory be there to get the notes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: I wasn't sure how to rate her, but here goes nothing. I loved Prof Ward as a person. Her humor makes the class bearable, but I made a 70 on every test. She goes over powerpoints and you take notes to what she says, but she makes you do a lot of reading & watching videos on your own time. It's a hit or miss. Some students LOVE her and some hated it.
rating_tags: Respected--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--Hilarious

comment: Professor Ward overall was a great teacher. Her lectures are sometimes hard to make it through, but she lays out all the information in a very simple way. She only gives 3 tests and 2 in-class writing assignments. Also, she doesn't give study guides, but lays out exactly what you need to know on the powerpoints and what to cover in the textbook.
